Vea dan 10 Murid SVP Bekasi Siap Unjuk Gigi di World Scholars Cup 2019 Amerika
07 Nov 2019, 10:30 by Anggi Tiar


Vea dan 10 Murid SVP Bekasi Siap Unjuk Gigi di World Scholars Cup 2019 Amerika

KBRN, Jakarta : Sebanyak 11 murid Sekolah Victory Plus atau SVP Bekasi sipa unjuk gigi pada ajang World Scholars Cup (WSC) 2019 atau Piala Cendekia Dunia di Universitas Yale, Cennecticut, Amwrika Serikat, mulai dari Kamis (7/11/2019) hari ini hingga, Rabu (13/11/2019) mendatang. 
WSC sendiri merupakan kompetisi yang diikuti para pelajar dari seluruh dunia. Tujuannya untuk menciptakan kompetisi yang berbeda dari yang sudah ada. Kategori yang dilombakan ajang ini sendiri diambil dari berbagai bidang seperti sains, sastra, sejarah, studi sosial, seni, dan musik.
Menurut salah satu murid SVP Bekasi yang turun dalam ajang ini, Marvella Mutiara sebelum babak terkahir ini bergulir, dirinya beserta rekan-rekannya telah menyelesaikan dua tahapan sebelumnya.
"Sebelum kami lomba dalam babak terakhir di Yale University, kami melewati dua babak dulu. Babak pertama (itu di tingkat) regional WSC (yang) diadakan di Jakarta. Kemudian babak kedua Global WSC (berlangsung) di Beijing, Cina," ujar wanita berparas cantik yang akrab disapa Vea itu dalam keterangan tertulis yang diterima wartawan di Jakarta, Kamis (7/11/2019).
Lebih lanjut, Vea sendiri mengaku sangat senang bisa tampil di ajang bergengsi tersebut. Apalagi diakuinya, mengikuti ajang itu merupakan mimpinya sejak lama. Oleh sebab itu, tampil di ajang ini akan menjadi pengalaman yang sangat berharga dalam hidupnya.
"Bangga bisa tampil dalam ajang ini. Keinginan yang lama terpendam sejak mengikuti lomba ini sejak kategori junior. Kami akan bersaing ketat dengan pelajar dari berbagai dunia. Ini challenge dan pengalaman sangat berharga buat kami," ujarnya.
Sementara itu, Fenty selaku guru pendamping siswa menerangkan untuk tahun ini Vea berangkat bersama sepuluh rekan yang lain. Di Amerika Serikat, mereka masuk kategori tim senior.
Selain Vea, sepuluh siswa lain dari sekolah yang berlokasi di Kemang Pratama Bekasi Selatan ini adalah Jovita Nakeisah Venska, Russel Revel Wijanto, Edmund Filbert Priyono, Bianca Benedicta, Yindy Lovelia, Ign Tobias Sembiring Soetjianto, Samuel Bhekti Rosena, Aldrin Akbar Darmawan, Lywen Viona Wendrya, dan Clara Inggrid Rouli Tambunan. Mereka turut didampingi Alexandra Aprilina, orangtua Vea.
"Ajang ini terbagi dalam dua tim, junior dan senior. Tim junior yakni yang berusia 14 tahun dan senior berusia 15 sampai 18 tahun. Tahun ini, kami mengirimkan empat tim, semuanya masuk kategori senior. Mereka akan mengikuti empat macam kompetisi yakni scholar’s challenge, writing collaboration, debatte, dan scholar bowl. Scholar's challenge itu adalah menguji mereka pada pengetahuan umum dunia. Di debatte mereka harus debat dengan peserta lain secara per tim," ujar Fenty.
"Kemudian mereka juga mengerjakan writing collaboration, membuat karangan dengan bahasa Inggris yang ceritanya harus terpadu antara masing-masing regu. Dan yang terakhir yakni kompetisi scholar bowl, siswa menjawab kuis di layar dengan total perolehan nilai harus 50 persen teratas dari peserta di satu level kompetisi," sambungnya.
Fenty menambahkan selain berbagai lomba itu, ajang ini juga menggelar cultural fair, di mana akan menampilkan budaya, tarian, makanan, dan pakaian negara masing masing. "Salah satunya Vea, dia akan berpakaian Tari Bali Legong," ucapnya.Menurutnya akan menjadi kebanggaan siswa bisa tampil di Universitas Yale, universitas swasta di New Haven, Connecticut yang didirikan pada 1701 sebagai collegiate school, Yale adalah institusi pendidikan tinggi ketiga tertua di Amerika Serikat. Universitas Yale selalu menjadi lokasi pelaksanaan dari kompetisi tertinggi level WSC.
"Ini puncak dari ajang WSC. Target kami, anak-anak bisa maksimal dan meraih medali serta trofi sebanyak-banyaknya," tutup Fenty.

Vea and 10 Bekasi SVP Students Ready to Show Their Tooth in the 2019 World Scholars Cup America
Nov 7 2019, 10:30 by Anggi Tiar


Vea and 10 Bekasi SVP Students Ready to Show Their Tooth in the 2019 World Scholars Cup America

KBRN, Jakarta: A total of 11 Victory Plus School students or SVP Bekasi held their teeth at the 2019 World Scholars Cup (WSC) at the Yale University, Cennecticut, United States of America, starting from Thursday (11/07/2019) today. until, Wednesday (11/13/2019) future.
WSC itself is a competition participated by students from all over the world. The aim is to create a competition that is different from existing ones. The categories contested by the event are taken from various fields such as science, literature, history, social studies, art, and music.
According to one of the Bekasi SVP students who took part in this event, Marvella Mutiara before the last round was rolling, she and her colleagues had completed the two previous stages.
"Before we competed in the last round at Yale University, we passed the first two rounds. The first round (at the regional level) WSC (which) was held in Jakarta. Then the second round of the Global WSC (took place) in Beijing, China," said the woman Beautiful, familiarly called Vea in a written statement received by reporters in Jakarta, Thursday (11/07/2019).
Furthermore, Vea herself admitted that she was very happy to be able to perform at this prestigious event. Moreover, he admitted, following the event was a long time dream. Therefore, appearing in this event will be a very valuable experience in his life.
"Proud of being able to appear in this event. The long-standing desire since participating in this competition since the junior category. We will compete closely with students from all over the world. This challenge and experience is very valuable for us," he said.
Meanwhile, Fenty as the student assistant teacher explained that this year Vea departed with ten other colleagues. In the United States, they are in the senior team category.
Besides Vea, ten other students from the school located in Kemang Pratama, South Bekasi are Jovita Nakeisah Venska, Russel Revel Wijanto, Edmund Filbert Priyono, Bianca Benedicta, Yindy Lovelia, Ign Tobias Sembiring Soetjianto, Samuel Bhekti Rosena, Aldrin Akbar Darmawan, Lywen Viona Priyono, Bianca Benedicta, Yindy Lovelia, Ign Tobias Sembiring Soetjianto, Samuel Bhekti Rosena, Aldrin Akbar Darmawan, Lywen Viona Wendrya, and Clara Inggrid Rouli Tambunan. They were accompanied by Alexandra Aprilina, Vea's parents.
"This event is divided into two teams, juniors and seniors. The junior team is 14 years old and seniors aged 15 to 18 years. This year, we sent four teams, all of them into the senior category. They will participate in four kinds of competitions namely scholar's challenge, "Writing collaboration, debatte, and scholar bowl. Scholar's challenge is to test them on general world knowledge. In debatte they have to debate with other participants on a team basis," said Fenty.
"Then they also work on writing collaboration, making essays in English whose stories must be integrated between each team. And finally, the scholar bowl competition, students answer quizzes on the screen with a total score of 50 percent of the participants at one level of competition. , "he continued.
Fenty added that besides the various competitions, this event also held a cultural fair, which would display the culture, dance, food, and clothing of each country. "One of them is Vea, she will dress in Balong Legong Dance," he said. According to him it would be a matter of pride for students to be able to perform at Yale University, a private university in New Haven, Connecticut which was founded in 1701 as a collegiate school, Yale is the third oldest institution of higher education in America Union. Yale University has always been the venue for the highest level of WSC competition.
"This is the culmination of the WSC event. Our target is that children can be maximal and win as many medals and trophies as possible," concluded Fenty.
